Hello I'm Blair Rorani. I'm desinging tools that help people and organisations create change. See me speak.

AITD 2015 Visual Note-Taking

Blair wrote this on 15 May

I spent a few days at the Australian Institute of Training and Development's 2015 conference in Sydney, Australia.

The AITD hired me to take visual notes from each of the talks.

Here's one.

Next Gen L&D Skills with a few legends @AnneBB @ryantracey @diegoinstudio @bbetts @jeevesj @catspyjamasnz #AITD2015 pic.twitter.com/0DMZiW8of2

— AITD (@aitd1) May 14, 2015

I started off with a quick lesson why visual note taking is a good idea, what to draw and how to apply all of this. Here are my slides. Like any good presentation they require me to present them for them to make any sense, but you can probably figure it out :)

Other people also got inspired to draw.

@MichelleOckers is drawing her notes. @blairrorani will be proud. #AITD2015 pic.twitter.com/JEIhbsxr88

— Ryan Tracey (@ryantracey) May 13, 2015

Design thinking for L&D - use personas and ask what they value. Use this as design criteria HT @wilko64 #AITD2015 pic.twitter.com/KLSVsqEIa8

— Michelle Ockers (@MichelleOckers) May 13, 2015

You can see more by checking the #aitd2015 hashtag.

If you want to get started taking visual notes, I wrote a book that teaches you how. You can check it out at everybodydrawnow.com.

#drawing
